intro: Hibbertia axillibarba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions such as New South Wales and Queensland. Hibbertia axillibarba is a shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height, with hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. It is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
